entry.title: his personal pet dog (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Winston Churchill was often portrayed as a bulldog (pictured), but his personal pet dog during the Second World War was a poodle?

entry.title: Gisele Thompson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that sisters Alyssa and Gisele Thompson are the first high school students to sign a name, image, and likeness deal with Nike?

entry.title: Shaparak Khorsandi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shaparak Khorsandi asked for her book to be removed from the Jhalak Prize longlist, which she considered to be "a sticker for being brown"?

entry.title: Eye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1999, British designer Alexander McQueen staged an Eye in the middle of a New York hurricane?

entry.title: Bob Harlan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bob Harlan was the first president of the Green Bay Packers without any roots in the Green Bay community?

entry.title: Pany Yathotou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pany Yathotou is the first woman vice president of Laos?

entry.title: Fumble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Piri released the song "Fumble" after her relationship ended?

entry.title: Olivia Benson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Cleese once called Olivia Benson "the weirdest cat I've ever seen in my life"?
